events.name: Next Bitcoin Meetup - Happy New Year  (Shinnenkai)
events.description: Happy New Year everyone! The price of Bitcoin may have you down, or greedy to buy more? In any case, join us for the first meetup of 2015. In Japanese, this is a Shinnenkai (Ode to Satoshi), a tradition of welcoming the arrival of the New Year, usually by the drinking of alcohol. We are working on having a regular bi-monthly meetup on Tuesdays at Ice Cold Beer at SMU. This will be the first. Let's show them we can bring a crowd of thirsty Bitcoiners! Hoping to have them ready to take Bitcoin as well! Dave Shin will be giving a presentation on what he's working on in the crypto space. Dave was a co-founder of The Bitcoin Association of Hong Kong, and recently moved to Singapore to set up Paywise.org here. Please RSVP so we can get an idea of total numbers. Thanks- see you on Tuesday.
events.location: Ice Cold Beer @ SMU, 50 Stamford Road, Singapore

events.name: iOS Dev Scout Jan Meetup
events.description: Venue: PlugIn@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-18, Singapore 139951 Speakers: 1. Akira Hirakawa from Burpple 2. Sasmito Adibowo from SAP Tentative Agenda: 7:00PM: Akira will talk about CameraKit - API library of Sony's lens camera that Akira has developed himself. GitHub repo: https://github.com/akirahrkw/QXCameraKit Demo: http://instagram.com/p/txmivXPIm7/ 7:45PM: Sasmito will share few important tips on how to design apps if you're not a designer 8:15PM: Show N Tell (if any)

events.name: January Meetup
events.description: Happy New Year Gophers! Hope you are excited for the first meetup of the 'Year of Gopher' ( http://twitter.com/davecheney/status/550276404026150912 ) . Here's the line-up for the Meetup: * Customising Your Own Web Framework in Go Jonathan Gomez, Engineer @ Zumata At Zumata we use Go in our main API. We've chosen a mix of using the Go standard library and bite-sized open-source components (i.e. handling routing/middleware/persistence), rather than adopting a fuller web framework, or relying purely on the standard lib. This talk outlines our experiences, and aims to help you get started building and structuring your APIs in Go. * Adventures in IoT with Golang Lakshan Perera & Audrey Lim Sharing our little experiments in trying to power anything and everything with Go. * Pop Quiz (10-20 mins) We are introducing a new segment from this year, so come prepared to write code (bring your laptop or a pen & paper) As usual, there will be pizza.
